channel.title: Posts on Yuhao's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Yuhao's Blog

item.title: RDMA Programming
item.description: Ref: https://www.coursera.org/learn/the-fundamentals-of-rdma-programming 1. RDMA Bypassing OS Traditionally, most socket application uses the socket API, for example, connect, accept, send and receive. All our functions are used to pass data from one point to another. Client connect() send() recv() Server accept() send() recv() RDMA programming is an alternative to socket programming. It gives you better latency and better utilization of your hardware if you have network interface cards that can work with it.

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Machine Learning Ref: https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning Mimic human learning process of generating output based on specified inputs, like a turning machine Supervised Machine Learning Regression and Classification Linear regression logistic regression gradient descent Neural Network Problem: high training error - high bias Solution: consider more features -> use larger neural network Problem: high correlation error - high variance Solution: cut weights of some features -> use more data Understanding comes from talent & intelligence, Deduction comes from learning & experience

item.title: Array and Strings
item.description: Ref: https://leetcode.com/explore/interview/card/leetcodes-interview-crash-course-data-structures-and-algorithms 1. Arrays C++ require you to specify the size and data type of the array during initialization but also have support for lists (like std::vector in C++). 2. Strings Strings are implemented differently between languages. In Python and Java, they are immutable. In C++, they are mutable. Mutable or immutable? If you have a mutable array arr = [“a”, “b”, “c”] and an immutable string s = “abc”, but you want to instead represent “abd”, you can easily do arr[2] = “d”, but you cannot do s[2] = “d”.
